About


This Website will assist you in getting fully 100% completion rate in Bully: Scholarship Edition. There will be a breakdown for each of the 6 chapters in the game with tips and facts alongside the main guide.


HTML


  • HTML 2.0

    • HTML 2.0 was a big step up from HTML 1.0, it was published in 1995 and kept all the features of 1.0 and then added a few new changes to the language as well. HTML 2.0 was the standard language for making websites until 1997 and had a lasting impact in the way that developers make their websites.

  • HTML 3.0

    • Dave Raggett created a new draft for HTML, in the draft was new features that allowed for greater web development , unfortunately a lot of the more powerful changes slowed down web browsers at the time.

  • HTML 4.01

    • HTML 4.01 focused on phasing out obsolete tags. Tags that were seen as obsolete were marked as deprecated and were generally replaced with CSS.

  • HTML 5

    • HTML 5 made major improvements for the language, such as replacing obsolete tags, adding Multimedia support that before HTML 5 would require the use of plugins such as Flash, it handles errors much better than HTML 4.01 and was an overall improvement.


HTML Timeline
Version Release Year
HTML 2.0 1995
HTML 3.0 1997
HTML 4.01 1999
HTML 5 2014

CSS


  • CSS 1

    • The first version of CSS to become an oficial W3C Recommendation, it was created by HÃ¥kon Wium Lie (pictured below) and Bert Bos. CSS 1 was capable of changing fonts, color of the backgrounds, text Allignment, Images and other useful abilities for websites at the time.

  • CSS 2.0

    • CSS 2 was developed by the W3C and added new features such as support for aural style sheets, the ability to change the positioning of elements like absolute, realative, and fixed positioning.

  • CSS 2.1

    • This version of CSS fixes errors that CSS 2.0 had. CSS 2.1 went through many drafts and was finally released on 12 April 2011. This was believed to be the last CSS 2 update but a low priority work began on CSS 2.2 in 2015

  • CSS3

    • CSS3 is unlike the previous versions as it is split up into seperate modules. With every new module, new features are added and previous CSS abilities are extended.




CSS Timeline
Version Release Year
CSS 1 1996
CSS 2.0 1998
CSS 2.1 2011
CSS3 2011

HTML Tags



Tag Names Use of Tag
DOCTYPE Used to declare the type of document such as HTML
html <html> This is the root of the document, it contains all the HTML elements
<head> This section contains information about links, style , and the title of the webpage
<title> This displays text in the browsers tab, such as the name of the webpage
<h1><h2><h3> These tags are used to define headings
<img> Tag used to link an image to the HTML document
<link> Used to link the HTML document to the Style sheet (CSS)
